intro: Acriopsis liliifolia, commonly known as the lily-leaved acriopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
